item.title: 乌克兰同意将国内生产总值认股权证转换为债权国债券
item.description: 乌克兰已与认股权证持有人达成协议，将与经济增长挂钩的证券转换为债券，推动重组，以帮助支撑其饱受战争蹂躏的财政。【原文：Ukraine has agreed with the holders of its warrants to convert the economic growth-linked securities into bonds, pushing through a restructuring to help shore up its war-torn finances.】

item.title: 窥探 Invesco 的 ETF 操作手册
item.description:
在本期Trillions节目中，我们将与该公司交易所交易基金全球主管讨论比特币、智能贝塔等问题。【原文：

In this episode of Trillions, we talk to the company’s global head of exchange-traded funds about Bitcoin, smart-beta and much more.

】

item.title: Blackstone 通过 CMBS 债务交易为仓库房地产投资信托基金收购提供资金
item.description: 据一位熟悉此事的人士透露，Blackstone Inc. 已完成与一系列英国仓库相关的债务交易，为其最近对 Warehouse REIT Plc 的收购提供资金。【原文：Blackstone Inc. has completed a debt deal tied to a string of British warehouses to fund its recent buyout of Warehouse REIT Plc, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 古巴贬值货币应对日益加深的经济危机
item.description: 古巴比索周四贬值，因为这个加勒比国家正试图稳定因美国制裁、打击地区盟友和主要收入来源崩溃而受到影响的经济。【原文：Cuba devalued the peso on Thursday as the Caribbean nation tries to stabilize an economy upended by US sanctions, a crackdown on regional allies and the collapse of key sources of revenue.】

item.title: Visma 将任命前环球支付首席执行官卡利法为非执行董事长
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，由 Hg 支持的软件公司 Visma 已任命 Worldpay 公司前首席执行官罗恩-卡利法（Ron Kalifa）为公司非执行董事长。【原文：Hg-backed software firm Visma has appointed Ron Kalifa, former chief executive officer of Worldpay Inc., as its non-executive chairman, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 涨幅达 101%，委内瑞拉债券持有人担心马杜罗会坚持下去
item.description: 委内瑞拉债务的持有者开始质疑，将债券推升至多年来最高点的涨势是否走得太远了。【原文：Holders of Venezuelan debt are starting to question whether the rally that pushed bonds to the highest in years has gone too far.】

item.title: Raiffeisen 老板离职，银行仍受俄罗斯问题困扰
item.description: 在 Raiffeisen Bank International 总部的九楼，可以俯瞰维也纳 19 世纪的城市公园，首席执行官约翰-施特罗布尔（Johann Strobl）喜欢用过去的悲惨轶事来迎接客人。【原文：On the ninth floor of Raiffeisen Bank International’s headquarters overlooking Vienna’s 19th-century Stadtpark, Chief Executive Officer Johann Strobl likes to greet guests with an anecdote of past woe.】

item.title: 欧洲央行官员称降息周期极有可能结束
item.description: 据熟悉这场辩论的人士称，根据最新的经济增长和通货膨胀前景，欧洲央行官员预计降息周期很可能已经结束。【原文：European Central Bank officials expect the cycle of interest-rate cuts to most likely be finished based on the latest outlook for growth and inflation, according to people familiar with the debate.】

item.title: 尽管特朗普施压，牛肉供应仍趋紧，牛肉价格创下历史新高
item.description: 即使特朗普政府试图通过促进进口和支持国内牧场主来控制成本，牛肉价格也没有降温的迹象。【原文：Beef prices show no sign of cooling, even as the Trump administration tries to rein in costs by boosting imports and support for domestic ranchers.】

item.title: 迷你对冲基金怀特黑文将退还现金，成为家族办公室
item.description: 怀特黑文资产管理公司（Whitehaven Asset Management）是一家专注于市政和公司债券的对冲基金，据管理合伙人斯科特-里奇曼（Scott Richman）称，该公司将返还投资者的资金，并成为一家家族办公室。【原文：Whitehaven Asset Management, a hedge fund focused on municipal and corporate bonds, will return investors’ money and become a family office, according to managing partner Scott Richman.】

item.title: 政策风险消退，外汇交易员押注 2026 年初风平浪静
item.description: 交易员们表示，货币波动将在新的一年里逐渐减弱，因为在可预见的未来，主要央行的政策路线看起来已经明确。【原文：Currency volatility will keep fading into the new year, traders say, with the policy paths of major central banks looking clearly defined for the foreseeable future.】

item.title: 泛捷航空公司意外亏损，投资者压力增大
item.description: 加拿大度假服务提供商 Transat AT Inc. 的股价在该公司未达盈利预期后下跌，这给管理层增加了压力，而该公司的一位大股东正要求做出改变。【原文：Shares of Canadian vacation provider Transat AT Inc. fell after the company missed earnings forecasts, adding pressure on management just as a major shareholder demands changes.】

item.title: 拉加德敦促审查欧洲央行董事会规则，施纳贝尔希望获得她的职位
item.description: 克里斯蒂娜-拉加德说，律师们之前认为，现任欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员没有资格担任主席，但她呼吁对这一问题进行更多研究。【原文：Christine Lagarde said lawyers previously reckoned that a serving European Central Bank Executive Board member would be ineligible for the presidency, but she called for more study on the matter.】

item.title: 人工智能初创公司 Edison 募集 7000 万美元加速科学研究
item.description: 一家开发人工智能软件以加速科学研究并使之自动化的初创公司在新一轮融资中筹集了7000万美元，这是投资者热衷于在科学领域使用人工智能的最新迹象。Edison Scientific公司周四宣布，本轮融资由火花资本（Spark Capital）、三原子资本（Triatomic Capital）和该公司拒绝透露姓名的一家美国生物技术投资者共同领投。其他参与者包括谷歌首席科学家杰夫-迪恩（Jeff Dean）和CrowdStrike联合创始人德米特里-阿尔佩罗维奇（Dmitri Alperovitch）。该基金【原文：A startup building artificial intelligence software to speed up and automate scientific research has raised $70 million in a new funding round, the latest sign of investor enthusiasm for using AI in the sciences. The financing for Edison Scientific, announced Thursday, was co-led by Spark Capital, Triatomic Capital and a US-based biotech investor that the company declined to name. Other participants included Google Chief Scientist Jeff Dean and CrowdStrike co-founder Dmitri Alperovitch. The fund】

item.title: 参议院民主党人要求贝森特提供阿根廷交换项目的详细情况
item.description: 民主党参议员伊丽莎白-沃伦（Elizabeth Warren）和珍妮-沙欣（Jeanne Shaheen）敦促财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）在特朗普政府同意援助南美经济以稳定外汇市场后，披露与阿根廷签订的 200 亿美元互换协议的 "有意义的 "细节。【原文：Democratic Senators Elizabeth Warren and Jeanne Shaheen urged Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent to disclose “meaningful” details on a $20 billion swap line with Argentina, after the Trump administration agreed to aid the South American economy for FX stabilization.】

item.title: 央行释放鹰派信号后，英国和德国债券表现不佳
item.description: 在欧洲中央银行和英格兰银行就各自的利率路径前景发出鹰派信号后，德国和英国债券的表现逊于美国同类债券。【原文：German and UK bonds underperformed US peers after the European Central Bank and Bank of England issued hawkish signals on the outlook for their respective interest-rate paths.】

item.title: 美国通胀数据缓解，科技前景乐观，标普 500 指数上涨
item.description: 由于一份冷于预期的通胀报告燃起了人们对美联储进一步降息的希望，股市在开盘时反弹，在周三大幅下挫后反弹。科技行业的乐观前景也提振了市场情绪。【原文：Stocks rallied at the open, bouncing after a sharp selloff Wednesday, as a cooler-than-expected inflation report lifted hopes that the Federal Reserve would cut interest rates further. An optimistic outlook in the tech sector also lifted sentiment.】

item.title: Blackstone 的 Schwarzman 称数据中心业务并非泡沫
item.description: 黑石集团（Blackstone Inc.首席执行官 Steve Schwarzman 撇开了围绕人工智能数据中心的泡沫之说，称该业务是保守的。【原文：Blackstone Inc. Chief Executive Officer Steve Schwarzman brushed aside talk of a bubble surrounding the data centers powering artificial intelligence, saying the business is conservative.】

item.title: 拉加德称人工智能对欧洲经济产生积极影响
item.description: 欧洲中央银行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德表示，人工智能正在对欧洲经济产生积极影响。【原文：Artificial intelligence is having a positive impact on Europe’s economy, according to European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde.】

item.title: 以下是美国 11 月份 CPI 报告的主要内容
item.description: 以下是周四公布的 11 月份美国消费者价格指数报告的主要内容：【原文：Here are the key takeaways from the US consumer price index report for November, released Thursday:】

item.title: 10 月份，人们通过电视观看了 7 亿小时的 YouTube 播客节目
item.description:
随着播客成为新的深夜电视，这一数字比一年前的 4 亿小时有所增加。【原文：

That’s up from 400 million hours a year ago as podcasts become the new late-night TV. 

】

item.title: 数据中心开发商为与谷歌合作的项目寻求 13 亿美元投资
item.description: Flash Compute LLC 正寻求通过出售垃圾债券筹集 12.8 亿美元，为一个与 Alphabet 公司旗下谷歌公司有关的数据中心提供资金，从而扩大人工智能热潮的借贷规模。【原文：Flash Compute LLC is seeking to raise $1.28 billion through a junk-bond sale to fund a data center linked to Alphabet Inc.’s Google, extending a borrowing spree powering the artificial-intelligence boom.】

item.title: 博尔索纳罗颠覆大选乐观预期，巴西外汇套期保值上升
item.description: 巴西前总统雅伊尔-博尔索纳罗支持自己的儿子参加明年的大选，而不是支持投资者最喜爱的塔尔西西奥-德弗雷塔斯（Tarcisio de Freitas），因此巴西交易商越来越多地对冲雷亚尔下跌的风险。【原文：Brazilian traders are increasingly hedging against a drop in the real after former President Jair Bolsonaro backed his son in next year’s election, instead of supporting investors’ favorite Tarcisio de Freitas.】

item.title: 摩根大通首席经济学家米歇尔称新兴市场债券的飙升尚未结束
item.description: 摩根大通资产管理公司（JPMorgan Asset Management）的鲍勃-米歇尔（Bob Michele）表示，即使美元的抛售压力可能减弱，但坚持今年最热门的新兴市场交易之一仍是迈向2026年的上策。【原文：JPMorgan Asset Management’s Bob Michele says sticking with one of this year’s hottest trades in emerging markets remains a top idea heading into 2026 even as the selling pressure on the US dollar is likely to wane.】

item.title: 法国电力集团将法国新建核电站的预算提高至 730 亿欧元
item.description: 法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）将其计划在本国建造的六个核反应堆的成本估算上调了 8%，达到 728 亿欧元（约合 850 亿美元），这凸显了随着建筑成本的持续上升，这家国有电力公司所面临的资金挑战。【原文：Electricite de France SA raised its cost estimates for the six nuclear reactors it plans to build in its home country by 8% to €72.8 billion ($85 billion), highlighting the funding challenge faced by the state-owned utility as construction costs continue to rise.】

item.title: 德国计划出售在美国举步维艰的 20 年期小众债券
item.description: 德国公布了出售 20 年期债券的计划，自美国财政部重新推出这一特殊期限的债券以来，市场反应不一。【原文：Germany unveiled plans to sell 20-year bonds, a niche maturity that has faced a mixed reception since being relaunched by the US Treasury.】

item.title: 慕尼黑再保险公司在国家支持下提供地热风险保险
item.description: 保险公司慕尼黑再保险公司和德国复兴信贷银行（KfW Development Bank）正在推出一项由国家支持的计划，以降低地热钻探的财务风险，并鼓励勘探这种可再生热能和电力来源。【原文：Insurer Munich Re and Germany’s KfW Development Bank are introducing a state-backed program to mitigate the financial risk of geothermal drilling and encourage exploration for the renewable heat and power source.】

item.title: 俄罗斯警告将就冻结资产向欧洲银行索赔
item.description: 俄罗斯央行向欧盟发出新的警告，称如果欧盟继续使用在欧洲冻结的资产来支持乌克兰，俄罗斯央行可能会在当地法院向欧洲贷款人寻求赔偿。【原文：Russia’s central bank issued a new warning to the European Union, saying it may seek compensation in local courts from European lenders should the bloc proceed with using assets frozen in Europe to support Ukraine.】

item.title: 印度原糖出口有望增加导致亏损扩大
item.description: 在主要生产国印度表示本榨季出口量可能超过计划后，原糖期货连续第四天下跌，创下两个多月来的最长连跌记录。【原文：Raw sugar futures headed for a fourth day of losses, the longest streak in more than two months, after major producer India said it may export more than planned this season.】

item.title: 美国核心 CPI 意外放缓至 2021 年以来最慢速度
item.description: 11 月份，美国基本通胀率以 2021 年初以来最慢的年增长率上升，这是在持续数月的顽固价格压力之后出现的意料之外的改善。【原文：Underlying US inflation rose in November at the slowest annual pace since early 2021, an unexpected improvement following months of stubborn price pressures.】
